label: Drive-Thru Queue Management
description: Real-time queue monitoring with predictive wait times reducing average wait from 5-7 minutes to 2.5-3.5 minutes and abandonment by 60-80% through intelligent capacity management.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customers join drive-thru queue with no visibility into wait time. 2. Queue backs up into street during lunch rush (safety hazard). 3. Customers abandon after waiting 8-10 minutes (15-25% abandonment during peak). 4. Staff unaware of queue length or customer frustration. 5. No proactive management or capacity adjustment.
constraints: No queue visibility for customers (unknown wait time)
15-25% abandonment during peak hours
Average wait time 5-7 minutes (industry benchmark)
Queue overflow into street creates safety issues
Staff reactive not proactive to queue buildup
Lost revenue from abandoned customers

agentic.workflow: 1. Queue Monitoring Agent tracks car count and position using sensors or cameras. 2. Wait Time Predictor calculates expected wait based on current orders and kitchen capacity: '6 cars ahead, 4 min wait'. 3. Mobile App Alert notifies customers: 'Drive-thru wait is 8 min, order inside for 3 min' (channel shift). 4. Dynamic Staffing alerts manager when queue exceeds capacity: 'Add expediter to reduce wait time'. 5. Overflow Management routes customers to mobile order pickup or inside counter when queue full.
benefits: 40-50% wait time reduction (2.5-3.5 min vs 5-7 min)
Channel shift to mobile/inside balances capacity

quickWins: Install vehicle detection sensors to count queue
Display estimated wait time on digital board

label: AI-Powered Voice Ordering
description: Conversational AI voice assistant with 95%+ accuracy reducing order time by 30-50% and freeing staff for food prep through automated order taking.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer arrives at speaker and waits for staff greeting (15-30 sec delay). 2. Staff manually takes order with background noise interference. 3. Staff asks clarifying questions: 'Did you say medium or large?'. 4. 8-12% order errors due to mishearing or miscommunication. 5. One staff member dedicated to drive-thru headset (can't assist kitchen).
constraints: 15-30 sec wait for staff greeting
8-12% order error rate from miscommunication
Background noise interferes with accuracy
Staff tied to headset, can't multitask
Accents and speech patterns create confusion
Peak hour overwhelm leads to rushed orders

agentic.workflow: 1. AI Voice Agent greets customer instantly upon arrival: 'Welcome to [Brand]! What can I get for you?'. 2. Natural Language Processing understands complex orders: 'Two Big Macs, one with no pickles, and a large fry'. 3. Confirmation Agent reads back order with visual display: 'I have 2 Big Macs, one no pickles, and large fry for $12.50. Is that correct?'. 4. Upsell Suggestion offers add-on: 'Would you like a drink to complete your meal?'. 5. Human Handoff transfers to staff for complex issues or customer preference.
dataSources: Complete menu database with items and modifiers
Speech recognition models trained on QSR vocabulary
benefits: 30-50% order time reduction (45-75 sec vs 90-120 sec)
Instant greeting (0 sec wait vs 15-30 sec)
Frees 1 staff member for food prep (labor optimization)

hitlGate.threshold: AI confidence score <85% or customer requests human
hitlGate.policy: Seamlessly transfer to human staff for complex orders, complaints, or upon customer request

quickWins: Pilot AI voice at 1-2 locations during off-peak hours
Train on top 50 menu items and common modifiers

label: Order Confirmation & Upsell
description: Visual order confirmation displays with targeted upsell offers increasing average ticket 15-25% and reducing errors by 70-85% through dual-channel verification.

traditional.workflow: 1. Staff verbally confirms order: 'So that's a Big Mac and fries, right?'. 2. Customer says 'yes' but order was actually entered wrong. 3. Customer realizes error at pickup window (too late to fix efficiently). 4. Upsell attempted verbally: 'Want to add a drink?' but easy to decline. 5. 10-15% order errors not caught until window.
constraints: Verbal confirmation relies on customer hearing correctly
10-15% errors reach window (costly to fix at that point)
Verbal upsell easy to ignore or decline
No visual reinforcement of order details
Complex orders difficult to confirm verbally
Staff inconsistent with upsell execution

agentic.workflow: 1. Visual Confirmation Display shows order details on screen at speaker: item names, customizations, prices, total. 2. Error Detection Agent highlights potential issues: 'No drink ordered - add one?'. 3. Personalized Upsell displays targeted offer: 'Add apple pie for $1.50 (pairs great with your meal)' with accept button. 4. Real-Time Edit allows customer to modify via touchscreen or voice before finalizing. 5. Order Lock Confirmation requires customer acknowledgment before proceeding to window.
benefits: 15-25% average ticket increase through visual upsell

quickWins: Install order confirmation displays at speaker box

label: Speed of Service Tracking
description: Real-time performance monitoring with automated alerts improving drive-thru speed by 20-35% and ensuring 90%+ of cars served under 3-minute target through data-driven optimization.

traditional.workflow: 1. Manager manually times cars with stopwatch during shift. 2. Times recorded on paper log for later review. 3. Weekly average calculated: 'We averaged 6.2 minutes last week'. 4. No real-time feedback or intervention during slow service. 5. Root causes of delays unknown (order taking vs kitchen vs payment?).
constraints: Manual timing sporadic and incomplete
Retrospective data doesn't enable real-time improvement
No breakdown by stage (speaker, kitchen, window)
Unknown root causes of delays
Manager distracted by stopwatch during peak
60-70% of cars served under 4-minute target (industry benchmark)

agentic.workflow: 1. Timer System tracks each vehicle through journey: speaker arrival, order complete, window arrival, exit. 2. Stage Breakdown identifies bottlenecks: 'Speaker time 90 sec (target 60), kitchen time 120 sec (target 90), window time 45 sec (on target)'. 3. Real-Time Alert notifies manager when car exceeds threshold: 'Car at window for 3 min (investigate delay)'. 4. Performance Dashboard shows live stats: '78% under 3 min today (target 90%), kitchen is current bottleneck'. 5. Coaching Opportunities highlight staff needing speed training.
dataSources: Vehicle detection at each checkpoint (speaker, window, exit)
Order timestamps (placed, sent to kitchen, completed)
Day of week and time of day patterns
benefits: 20-35% speed improvement through real-time monitoring and intervention
Real-time alerts enable immediate corrective action
metrics: Delay root cause: Identified by stage

quickWins: Deploy vehicle timers at speaker and window
Create real-time dashboard for manager monitoring

label: Dynamic Menu Board Pricing
description: Real-time digital menu updates with daypart optimization and promotional management increasing revenue 8-15% through strategic pricing and merchandising.

traditional.workflow: 1. Static printed menu boards updated quarterly at best. 2. Same menu shown all day (breakfast items at dinner, lunch combos at breakfast). 3. Promotional changes require physical menu replacement ($500-$2000 per location). 4. Price changes delayed by printing lead time (4-6 weeks). 5. Limited-time offers difficult to add/remove quickly.
constraints: Quarterly menu updates miss promotional opportunities
Static daypart - breakfast menu shown during lunch
$500-$2000 cost per menu update
4-6 week lead time for menu changes
No A/B testing of menu layout or pricing
Can't respond to competitor pricing or demand shifts

agentic.workflow: 1. Dynamic Menu Agent switches content by daypart: breakfast menu 6-10:30am, lunch 10:30am-4pm, dinner after 4pm. 2. Promotional Engine highlights limited-time offers at top: 'Try our new Spicy Chicken Sandwich - $5.99'. 3. Inventory Integration removes 86'd items instantly: chicken nuggets sold out, automatically removed from menu. 4. Pricing Optimization adjusts prices by demand: raise combo price $0.50 during peak, discount $1 during slow periods. 5. A/B Testing tries menu layouts: Feature image vs list format, measure conversion impact.
dataSources: Demand patterns by time and day
A/B test results and optimization metrics
benefits: 8-15% revenue increase through optimized pricing and merchandising
Instant menu updates vs 4-6 week lead time

quickWins: Replace static boards with digital displays

label: Payment Processing Optimization
description: Contactless payment integration with mobile wallet support reducing payment time by 40-60% and transaction errors by 80-90% through streamlined digital payments.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer hands cash or card to staff at window. 2. Staff manually enters card, waits for approval (15-30 sec). 3. Card reader errors require retry or different payment method. 4. Cash transactions require change-making (error-prone, time-consuming). 5. Payment averages 45-60 seconds of window time.
constraints: 45-60 sec payment time extends overall drive-thru time
Card reader errors frustrate customers (5-8% failure rate)
Cash handling errors and shortages
Physical card exchange creates pandemic concerns
No mobile wallet or contactless support
Staff distracted counting change during peak

agentic.workflow: 1. Mobile Payment Agent enables in-app payment before reaching window (zero window time). 2. Contactless Terminal accepts tap payments: Apple Pay, Google Pay, contactless cards (3-5 sec transaction). 3. Auto-Tender calculates exact change and dispenses automatically (cash customers). 4. Payment Routing selects fastest method: contactless > chip > swipe with automatic retry on failure. 5. Receipt Options send digital receipt via email/SMS (no printer delay).
benefits: 40-60% payment time reduction (20-30 sec vs 45-60 sec)
Digital receipts reduce paper waste and printer maintenance

quickWins: Enable Apple Pay and Google Pay acceptance

label: Drive-Thru Analytics & Bottleneck Detection
description: AI-powered performance analytics with predictive bottleneck identification enabling 25-40% throughput improvement through data-driven operational insights and continuous optimization.

traditional.workflow: 1. Manager reviews weekly drive-thru report: 'Average time 5.8 minutes, 142 cars per hour'. 2. Basic averages don't reveal root causes or patterns. 3. Manager guesses at improvements: 'Maybe we need more staff?'. 4. No visibility into what specifically is slowing service. 5. Quarterly reviews too infrequent for rapid improvement.
constraints: Weekly/monthly reporting too slow for actionable insights
Averages hide important patterns and outliers
Unknown root causes (speaker vs kitchen vs window delays)
No predictive capability (react after problems occur)
Gut-feel decision making vs data-driven
Can't quantify impact of operational changes

agentic.workflow: 1. Analytics Engine processes every transaction: order time, kitchen time, payment time, total time by vehicle. 2. Bottleneck Detection Agent identifies constraints in real-time: 'Kitchen is current bottleneck (80% of delays), specifically grill station overloaded'. 3. Pattern Recognition finds insights: 'Payment delays spike 2-3pm daily when new shift starts (retraining needed)'. 4. Predictive Model forecasts issues: 'Lunch rush in 30 min, current staffing insufficient - add 1 kitchen expediter'. 5. Optimization Recommendations suggest fixes: 'Moving payment reader 2 feet closer saves avg 8 seconds per transaction'.
dataSources: Complete transaction data (times, items, staff, outcomes)
benefits: Real-time bottleneck identification enables immediate action
Predictive forecasting prevents issues before they occur
Multi-location benchmarking and best practice sharing

quickWins: Deploy analytics dashboard showing stage-level breakdowns
